review: So far, it seems clever, but wants a pay per view limited youtube at 1.99 rates. I want the freedom to watch my own content. If I can get my tablet viewing on the big screen, I'll keep it, else it goes back. $2 day X 30 days = $60/mo. That is costly. No, prime is not the answer as the content switches between bouts of plenty of good free choices, then dry spells designed to get you to pay. Amazon instant video has problems, too, as the categories can't be controlled. You log in and pages of kids cartoons are presented. Um, no thanks. I want things more customized.

review: The device wont store your favorite apps in a static display and continuously rotates through recent apps. So, if you are expecting a response like Roku or other media devices you'll be disappointed. The device also has very limited storage capacity so you cannot really take advantage of the games function. It also logs me out of Netflix periodically for some reason. Finally, the voice search feature is okay but it will mostly find stuff available on Prime, not all TV networks. All in all, it was not a worthy replacement to my existing Roku device but I am keeping it to see if it improves.

I need to get a bigger broadband pipe.

review: I got the fire TV because i heard so many good reviews about it. The price tag of 124.00 for the device plus a controller was worth it as this box has replaced both hulu and netflix as far as my fiancee and I are concerned.  While netflix and hulu provide their own benefits in a way, I feel that the price tag associated with their content is a bit out of touch with the average american living under the poverty line. I am enjoying the prime membership to its fullest and feel that $100 a year for such a great service is little compared to a so far endless enjoyment. The only thing id wish they would include would be more amazon fire applications that would be compatible with the TV.  I am inspired to get an amazon fire tablet just so i can take the quality and the functionality with me.If you are looking for a product that offers the same service as netflix and hulu but has a decent price tag per year.. Grab this device.
